props.name: onPageSelect
props.docblock:
specifies a callback function that is executed when the user selects a page button or the `Previous`/`Next` buttons. For example:

```jsx
<Pagination onPageSelect={(pageNumber) => { console.log(pageNumber); } />
```

description.text:
specifies a callback function that is executed when the user selects a page button or the `Previous`/`Next` buttons. For example:

```jsx
<Pagination onPageSelect={(pageNumber) => { console.log(pageNumber); } />
```

props.name: pageCount
props.docblock: specifies the total number of pages in the `Pagination` component.

description.text: specifies the total number of pages in the `Pagination` component.

props.name: paginationLabel
props.docblock: specifies the `aria-label` for the `<nav>` element that wraps the pagination button list.

description.text: specifies the `aria-label` for the `<nav>` element that wraps the pagination button list.

defaultValue.value:
{
  previous: 'Previous',
  next: 'Next',
  page: 'Page',
  currentPage: 'Current Page',
  pageOfCount: 'of',
}

props.name: buttonLabels
className
props.docblock: specifies any class name(s) for the `Pagination` component. The default is an empty string.

description.text: specifies any class name(s) for the `Pagination` component. The default is an empty string.

props.name: currentPage
props.docblock: specifies the page that the `Pagination` component will automatically select. The default is `1`.

description.text: specifies the page that the `Pagination` component will automatically select. The default is `1`.

props.name: maxPagesDisplayed
props.docblock: specifies the number of page buttons to display in between the `Previous` and `Next` buttons. This number also includes any ellipses in the total count. Also, to ensure that at least one clickable page button is shown when both ellipses are displayed, this value must be greater than `4`.  The default is `7`.

description.text: specifies the number of page buttons to display in between the `Previous` and `Next` buttons. This number also includes any ellipses in the total count. Also, to ensure that at least one clickable page button is shown when both ellipses are displayed, this value must be greater than `4`.  The default is `7`.

props.name: icons
props.docblock: specifies icons used to signal previous and next page. can be an element, string, symbol, etc. default is chevrons rendered using fa-css.

description.text: specifies icons used to signal previous and next page. can be an element, string, symbol, etc. default is chevrons rendered using fa-css.
